title: Married At First Sight: Elizabeth Sobinoff's new husband pictured as she returns for season seven
text:
Elizabeth Sobinoff's new husband has been pictured moments before he tied the knot with the former Married At First Sight star.

Dressed in a sharp navy suit, the mystery man failed to evade the paparazzi during their nuptials at Curzon Hall in Sydney earlier this month.

It comes after Elizabeth, 27, was revealed to be returning to the show as an intruder bride - following her first appearance on the previous season with Sam Ball.

Mystery man! Elizabeth Sobinoff's new husband (pictured) was seen chatting to the show's producers ahead of the ceremony

In the photographs, her new husband was seen chatting to the show's producers ahead of the ceremony.

He cut a dapper figure as he waited to see his new bride for the first time.

Elizabeth's relatives - including her mum, dad and sister - were also in attendance for her special day.

She's back! Elizabeth, 27, was revealed to be returning to the show as an intruder bride in the upcoming seventh season

Glammed up! Friends of Elizabeth and her new husband dressed up in frocks and suits for the big day

Friends of Elizabeth and her new husband dressed up in frocks and suits for the non-legally binding ceremony.

Elizabeth's mum donned a flattering blue and red spotty dress for her daughter's big day.

While her dad was spotted having his microphone adjusted by a member of the production team.

Happy families: Elizabeth's relatives - including her mum, dad and sister - were also in attendance at the ceremony

Getting ready! Elizabeth's dad (pictured) was spotted having his microphone adjusted by a member of the production team

It's not the first time Elizabeth's dad has walked his daughter down the aisle after he attended her previous MAFS wedding with Sam.

He opted for a grey suit this time around as he watched Elizabeth tie the knot.

Security was on 'high alert' during filming, with Elizabeth spending the entire shoot under the cover of a gazebo in order to evade the paparazzi.

Suited and booted: Elizabeth's dad (pictured) opted for a grey suit this time around as he watched Elizabeth tie the knot

Second time lucky? It's not the first time Elizabeth's dad has walked his daughter down the aisle after he attended her previous MAFS wedding with Sam

Elizabeth and her on-screen husband, whose identity is unknown, were introduced to the cast at a dinner party filmed in Lilyfield on Thursday night.

A source close to production said: 'Nobody saw it coming. Everybody was shocked when she walked through the door.'

Channel Nine declined to comment.

Happily ever after? Elizabeth was paired with Sam Ball (right) on last year's season of MAFS, but their 'marriage' ended in tears when he cheated on her with another bride, Ines Basic

Elizabeth was paired with Sam Ball on last year's season of MAFS, but their 'marriage' ended in tears when he cheated on her with another bride, Ines Basic.

On their wedding day, Sam infamously 'fat shamed' Elizabeth by saying he didn't 'usually date girls her size'.

He also told producers that he would 'get her running in the mornings' to lose weight, sparking a furious backlash from viewers.

Guess who's back! Elizabeth filmed her second MAFS wedding on Thursday, October 17 at Curzon Hall in Sydney, with security on 'high alert' during filming to avoid spoilers leaking

Since filming MAFS season six last year, Elizabeth has completely transformed her appearance and lost an impressive 10kg in the process.

'I love my body... at any size,' she recently told NW magazine.

'I've thought that when I weighed 49kg and when I've weighed 90kg. I want women to realise that we're all so much more than a number on a scale,' she added.

'So, yes, I've lost some weight since I was a "huge" size 10 when I was on MAFS, but that doesn't mean I'm any "better" now, just because I'm slimmer.'
description: Elizabeth Sobinoff's new husband (pictured) has been seen moments before he tied the knot with the former Married At First Sight star.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
